Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, fabric is brown/black in section, interior spotted with traces of a black resinous substance, with remains of ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.98-99)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87605) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87605)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 107 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
